subject: Photography
title: Bounce Light and Reflectors
description: A micro-lesson that makes Bounce Light and Reflectors usable.

hook.text: A white wall next to your subject is a light source. It bounces light back and fills in shadows for free.

buildup.text: Bounce light is indirect light reflected off a surface. The reflecting surface becomes a new, softer light source.

discovery.text: Photographers use reflectors â€” white, silver, or gold â€” to redirect light into shadow areas and reduce contrast.

twist.text: Gold reflectors add warmth. Silver reflectors add punch. White reflectors add neutral fill. Color matters.

climax.text: A simple white board is the cheapest, most effective lighting tool in all of photography.

punchline.text: The best lighting tool costs nothing. It's a wall.

quiz.question: What does a gold reflector add to the bounced light?
